meanings.definition: A person who is unwilling to spend money; a miser.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is such a tightwad that he never buys anything new.
meanings.sent2: The tightwad refused to contribute to the group gift.
meanings.sent3: The tightwad brought a bag of homemade snacks to the expensive restaurant.
meanings.sent4: She's a tightwad when it comes to compliments, never sparing a kind word.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tightwad counting every penny stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To be stingy or frugal with money.
meanings.sent1: I tend to tightwad my spending during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: He always tightwads when it comes to buying gifts for others.
meanings.sent3: She decided to tightwad her allowance and save up for a new bike.
meanings.sent4: The company had to tightwad their budget due to unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: Don't tightwad on experiences; they are worth more than money.
